stories.text:
Nice to see that YouTube has the situation under control lol.

same domain for the past 3 days.

shibget.com

I have compiled a bunch of other domains but this one is probably by far the most profitable.

https://etherscan.io/address/0xDed28f848FE916E6Ec1400449eB2670a704391D8#tokentxns

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hqWLzMfHD8Y

other ones:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=la22wjeOFE8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ub5dS8Bc3Gc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XdFrXkCVNsk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DEZ65g6AlGw

I think the subtotal for the past 3 days is around $1.3 million stolen at today's shib/eth prices, much of it made by I believe to be two individuals. Some of it went to exchanges though.

One is using REG.RU for both domain registration and nameservers, the other individual is using cloudflare for DNS and nic.ru for the registrar.

This blows any other organized crime away in terms of profitability, scalability, consistency, and most importantly, not being caught. The same people doing this for years. Youutbe at this point is a willing accomplice for not doing more.
stories.title: $170k Stolen Shiba Livestream Scam on YouTube

stories.text:
What do you use to handle 2FA? Sms? Email? or an Authenticator app?

What problems do you face with whatever 2FA you use? Are there security issues with any of them?

In case you use a phone based 2FA, is the phone not having internet/network a frequent problem?
